intro: Echinocephalum latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf echinocephalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Echinocephalum latifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
